## Description of region

I am focusing on Claremont, CA.

![View from Johnson's Pasture in Claremont, California](https://external-content.duckduckgo.com/iu/?u=https%3A%2F%2Fi0.wp.com%2Ftrailtopeak.com%2Fwp-content%2Fuploads%2F2018%2F03%2FDSC02261.jpg)

```{r importing_data, echo=FALSE}
### 1: Importing data
claremontDF <- read.csv("~/Climate_Change_Narratives/Data/FA20/Chang_ClaremontCA_data.csv")
# str(claremontDF) # uncomment and run to view structure of the data frame claremontDF

### 1.1: Cleaning date-string objects
claremontDF$DateStr <- as.Date( as.character(claremontDF$DATE), "%Y-%m-%d" ) # convert object to character and turn it into a new date
```

This first plot shows all of the monthly averages for the `TMAX` variable (daily observations) for Claremont, CA.

```{r monthly_averages}
### 2: Project guide 3, creating months to aggregate data
claremontDF$Month = format(as.Date(claremontDF$DateStr), format = "%m")
claremontDF$Year = format(claremontDF$DateStr, format="%Y")

### 2.1: Aggregating TMAX into monthly means
MonthlyTMAXMean = aggregate(TMAX ~ Month + Year, claremontDF, mean)
MonthlyTMAXMean$YEAR = as.numeric(MonthlyTMAXMean$Year)
MonthlyTMAXMean$MONTH = as.numeric(MonthlyTMAXMean$Month)
# str(MonthlyTMAXMean) # uncomment and run if you want to see a high level description of the data frame

### 2.2: Visualize new monthly averages
plot(TMAX~YEAR, data=MonthlyTMAXMean, ylab="Monthly averages of daily TMAX", type="p",col=POMblue,las=1)
```
